discussion.content: If we set ipv6 access-list, we must apply ipv6 traffic-filter and ipv6 access-class, not ip.

choices.B: The destination must be 172.30.30.2 for icmp-echo.
choices.C: A route back to the R1 LAN network is missing in R2.
choices.D: The default route has wrong next hop IP address.
choices.E: The threshold value is wrong. AC

discussion.content:
The threshold value doesn't make sense in relation to timeout : if you wait 5 times longer than the statistical threshold, then 
 you don't need statistics, so C&E is correct...

comments.content: I am going to recant ;-) my previous statement , this threshold value wouldn't make this fail it's correct and indeed source should be f0/0 in my opinion, so it's A&C

discussion.content: I thought one of the issues would be the no ip router 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 172.20.20.2. Wouldn't that get rid of tracking? The answer the source-interface is configured incorrectly could just mean the interface configuration is wrong. Other than that I don't see why it would fail.

comments.content: that line is only deleting an ip route without track, the other two ip route lines are the functionality ones.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A,C is right, the router R2 of ISP don't have the route of the Lan connected to R1.

comments.content: so the only answers left is A and C. B is correct, destination must be on primary link for ip sla icmp-echo, and threshold value is correct

OK, D is not the correct answer but not for the reason you say. in "ip route 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 172.30.30.2 5", the 5 is the administrative distance that they're setting for the floating static route so that the secondary link takes over when the primary link goes down.
I think that it is a Typo "ip route 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 172.30.30.2.5", the las number "5" is the administrative distance, correct "ip route 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 172.30.30.2 5"

discussion.content: "ip route 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 172.30.30.2.5" is wrong, because the next hop is not an valid ip address 172.30.30.2.5 However, it does not affect the ip sla tracking failure .

For all other IP SLAs operations, the following configuration guideline is recommended:
(frequencyseconds ) > (timeoutmilliseconds ) > (thresholdmilliseconds )
10 sec > 5 sec > 0.5 sec
So, threshold is correct and E is wrong option
So, I think answer maybe --> A and C --> It is actually A or C can cause the problem but not together
source interface= Fa0/0 (icmp ingress source) & R2 should have a return route to R1 LAN.

Answer is incorrect: Source interface is configured correctly. The last config line seems to have a wrong IP address as next hop.
I would say CD are correct.
Note: this question circulates in different forms. There are versions in which the source address is wrond indeed.

Correct

Prerequisites for Configuring Stateful Network Address Translation 64

Example Configuring NetFlow Multiple Export Destinations
The following example shows how to configure NetFlow multiple export destinations:

configure terminal
!
ip flow-export destination 10.10.10.10 9991
ip flow-export destination 172.16.10.2 9991
!
Note 
You can configure a maximum of two export destinations for the main cache and for each aggregation cache.

B
"The most common use of the multiple-destination feature is to send the NetFlow cache entries to two different destinations for redundancy. Therefore, in most cases the second destination IP address is not the same as the first IP address. The port numbers can be the same when you are configuring two unique destination IP addresses. If you want to configure both instances of the command to use the same destination IP address, you must use unique port numbers. You receive a warning message when you configure the two instances of the command with the same IP address. The warning message is, "%Warning: Second destination address is the same as previous address <ip-address>"."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios/netflow/command/reference/nf_book/nf_01.html

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
configure terminal
ip flow-export destination 192.168.10.1 9991
ip flow-export version 9
How can you configure a second export destination for IP address 192.168.10.1?

choices.D: Configure a version 5 flow-export to the same destination

questions.answer_description:
Do not enter the same ip address twice. However, entering two different ip addresses with the same udp port number is configurable

show crypto ipsec sa
This command shows IPsec SAs built between peers. The encrypted tunnel is built between 12.1.1.1 and 12.1.1.2 for traffic that goes between networks 20.1.1.0 and 10.1.1.0. You can see the two Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP) SAs built inbound and outbound. Authentication Header (AH) is not used since there are no AH SAs.
This output shows an example of the show crypto ipsec sa command (bolded ones found in answers for this question). interface: FastEthernet0
